Thursday, May 10, 2007























Supernova dazzles scientists
Scientists have just released images of the brightest stellar explosion recorded. The explosion could help astronomers better understand how the first generation of stars in the universe died.
FULL STORY




















Mercury's molten core
Scientists have discovered that Mercury's core may be partially molten.
FULL STORY






Life in space
Given the choice, Russian cosmonauts would likely never come back to Earth.
FULL STORY






Digging for past life on Mars
A robotic probe designed to touch and analyze Martian water for the first time is being prepared for launch.
FULL STORY






Gassy planet a real scorcher
A planet orbiting a star in the constellation Hercules may be the hottest known yet, scientists said.
FULL STORY
